title: What is the importance of eye contact and facial expressions in inducing hypnosis?
first_phrase: In the previous section, we discussed how hypnosis works and its connection with the magnetic force of the human body. In this last section, we will explore some scientific experiments and researches related to the power of the gaze and facial expressions on human behavior, conducted by scholars such as Rupert Sheldrake, Paul Ekman, and Evan Marshal. We will also mention the famous ethologist Desmond Morris and his book, "The Naked Ape," which explains the human mind and behavior in evolutionary terms. Finally, we will touch upon the role of the cerebral cortex in human reasoning and its significance in hypnotic induction.

last_phrase: In conclusion, while the feeling of being stared at may not depend on known sensory clues, research such as Fast and theories proposed by ethologists and hypnotists suggest that multiple phenomena at various levels occur concurrently.
